summary: This document is a compilation of daily lieutenant's logs from the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York for July 30, 2019. It details routine operations, counts, and security checks, with specific notes on inmate Jeffrey Epstein's status, including his placement on psychological observation and his transfer within the facility. The logs end with Epstein being held in the facility that night.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Inmate #76318-054, noted to be at a local hospital under USMS guard on psychological observation with an inmate companion in the morning, and later released from HA (likely Housing Area) to ZA (likely another unit/area) at 12:21 PM.

events.title: Epstein on Psychological Observation
events.description: Inmate Jeffrey Epstein is noted to be at a local hospital under USMS guard on psychological observation with an inmate companion during the morning shift.

events.title: Epstein Transferred Within MCC
events.description: At 12:21 PM, inmate Jeffrey Epstein (#76318-054) was released from HA (Housing Area) to ZA (another unit/area) within the Metropolitan Correctional Center.

events.title: Daily Facility Operations and Counts
events.description: Routine security checks, body alarm tests, inmate counts, and facility operations are conducted throughout the day across three shifts (Morning, Day, Evening Watch).

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY
keyFacts: On July 30, 2019, Jeffrey Epstein was an inmate (#76318-054) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.
Epstein was under psychological observation at a local hospital with USMS guards and an inmate companion during the morning.
Epstein was transferred within the MCC from HA to ZA at 12:21 PM on July 30, 2019.
The facility logs show routine operations but note a fire alarm system malfunction preventing standard PREA announcements.
By the end of the logging period (Evening Watch), the inmate count was 760, with two inmates noted at local hospitals.
